deacon.title: The Call to Serve
deacon.message: You are now a 'standing minister.' This means even when you aren't passing the sacrament, you represent Jesus Christ.
deacon.challenge: Identify one way you can act as the Lord's representative at school today.

deacon.title: Ministering of Angels
deacon.message: The Aaronic Priesthood holds the keys of the ministering of angels. You open the door for heavenly help.
deacon.challenge: Log a morning prayer asking for the companionship of the Spirit.

deacon.title: Clean Vessels
deacon.message: Priesthood power is like electricity; it needs a clean wire. Worthiness is your power.
deacon.challenge: Choose one habit to stop today to make your 'wire' cleaner.

deacon.title: Watching the Church
deacon.message: Deacons assist the Bishop in temporal (physical) ways. You are his hands in the ward.
deacon.challenge: Ask a parent if an elderly neighbor needs their trash cans moved or mail brought in.

deacon.title: The Fast Offering
deacon.message: Helping the poor is a primary priesthood duty. Your service feeds the hungry.
deacon.challenge: Think of three things you are grateful for and record them in your journal.

deacon.title: Sabbath Prep
deacon.message: Excellence in the ordinance shows respect for the Savior. Review your passing route.
deacon.challenge: Text your Quorum President to confirm your assignment for tomorrow.

deacon.title: Sunday Reflection
deacon.message: It is time to report your stewardship to the Lord. How did you serve this week?
deacon.challenge: Complete the 5-question Sunday Inventory on the Dashboard.

teacher.title: The Peacemaker
teacher.message: Your duty is to 'watch over the church always.' Notice who is missing from your quorum.
teacher.challenge: Reach out to one quorum member you haven't seen in a while.

teacher.title: No Iniquity
teacher.message: You are a guardian of the ward's spirit. Ensure there is no backbiting or gossip.
teacher.challenge: If you hear gossip today, stay silent or change the subject.

teacher.title: The Preparer
teacher.message: Preparing the sacrament table is a sacred physical act. It is the foundation for the ordinance.
teacher.challenge: Check the sacrament table supplies (bread, cups) before Sunday.

teacher.title: Strengthen the Church
teacher.message: True strength comes from being a friend. Minister as the Savior did—one by one.
teacher.challenge: Identify a friend who is struggling and offer a word of encouragement.

teacher.title: Ministering Partner
teacher.message: You are a junior partner to an Elder. Your voice and spirit are needed in your visits.
teacher.challenge: Ask your companion: 'How can I best help our families this month?'

teacher.title: Mental Virtue
teacher.message: Let virtue garnish thy thoughts. Priesthood power requires a clean mind.
teacher.challenge: Replace one negative or impure thought today with a hymn or scripture.

teacher.title: Sunday Reflection
teacher.message: Account for your week as a watchman. How has your quorum improved because of you?
teacher.challenge: Arrive 15 minutes early for your preparation assignment.

priest.title: Ordinance Authority
priest.message: You hold the authority to baptize. You are a gatekeeper to the Kingdom of God.
priest.challenge: Read the baptismal prayer. Reflect on the gravity of those words.

priest.title: Sacrament Prayers
priest.message: These prayers are a contract between the ward and God. They must be spoken with exactness.
priest.challenge: Memorize the first three lines of the bread prayer today.

priest.title: Keys of Repentance
priest.message: You hold the keys of the Gospel of Repentance. You help people start over every week.
priest.challenge: Reflect on how the sacrament helps you personally repent.

priest.title: Preach and Exhort
priest.message: A Priest's duty is to preach and teach. You are a missionary in training.
priest.challenge: Prepare a 2-minute spiritual thought for your next meeting.

priest.title: Bishop's Assistant
priest.message: The Bishop is your Quorum President. You are his direct hands in helping the youth.
priest.challenge: Ask the Bishop: 'How can I help you with the youth this week?'

priest.title: Font Readiness
priest.message: Preparation shows respect. Even if you aren't baptizing, be worthy to do so.
priest.challenge: Check that your white clothing is clean and fits properly.

priest.title: Sunday Reflection
priest.message: Did you handle the emblems of the Savior with dignity today? Report to the Lord.
priest.challenge: Pray for each person you pass the sacrament to today.

elder.title: The High Calling
elder.message: Elders have a right to 'all the spiritual blessings of the church.' You are a spiritual leader.
elder.challenge: Identify one area where you need more spiritual power in your life.

elder.title: The Healer's Art
elder.message: You are called to heal the sick. This requires faith and a clean life.
elder.challenge: Ensure your oil vial is filled and you know where it is.

elder.title: Ministering Shepherd
elder.message: You don't just 'visit'; you shepherd. A shepherd knows his sheep by name.
elder.challenge: Pray for one family on your ministering list by name today.

elder.title: Presiding in Love
elder.message: True leadership is persuasion and long-suffering. Avoid 'unrighteous dominion.'
elder.challenge: Practice patience in a moment of frustration at home or work today.

elder.title: The Oath and Covenant
elder.message: You have entered a sacred contract with God. He promises all He has in return for your service.
elder.challenge: Read the 'Oath and Covenant' section of D&C 84.

elder.title: Temple Ready
elder.message: The Melchizedek Priesthood is inextricably linked to the Temple.
elder.challenge: Check your Temple Recommend. If expired, set an appointment today.

elder.title: Sunday Reflection
elder.message: Did you lead your family and quorum with the Spirit this week? Reflect and reset.
elder.challenge: Hold a family council or personal study session on next week's goals.

days.title: The Aaronic Restoration
days.message: Study the restoration of the Aaronic Priesthood and the keys it restored.
days.challenge: Record one way the Aaronic Priesthood blesses your daily service.

days.title: The Melchizedek Restoration
days.message: Review the testimony of angelic messengers and the restoration of priesthood keys.
days.challenge: Write a brief summary of why the Melchizedek Priesthood matters to you.

days.title: The Keys of Elijah
days.message: Study Elijah’s keys and the sealing power restored.
days.challenge: Identify one way you can strengthen family connections this week.

days.title: The Keys of Gathering
days.message: Focus on the keys of gathering Israel and the work of bringing souls to Christ.
days.challenge: Reach out to someone who could be invited back to worship.

days.title: The Keys of the Gospel of Abraham
days.message: Reflect on the blessings promised through the Abrahamic covenant.
days.challenge: Pray to better understand your role in God’s covenant family.

days.title: The Witness of Three
days.message: Study the testimony of the Three Witnesses and how it anchors faith.
days.challenge: Record one personal witness you have received from the Lord.

days.title: Sunday Reflection
days.message: How has knowing the source of your authority changed your confidence this week?
days.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

days.title: The Articles and Covenants
days.message: Review the foundational declaration of the Church’s doctrine and purpose.
days.challenge: List one doctrine that strengthens your priesthood service.

days.title: The Offices: Deacon and Teacher
days.message: Study the duties of deacons and teachers within the Aaronic Priesthood.
days.challenge: Identify a duty you can elevate with more reverence.

days.title: The Offices: Priest and Elder
days.message: Study the duties of priests and elders and their authority to act.
days.challenge: Write one way you can magnify your office this week.

days.title: The High Priesthood
days.message: Reflect on the power and responsibility of the Melchizedek Priesthood.
days.challenge: Pray for increased humility and power to serve.

days.title: The Bishop’s Role
days.message: Consider the Bishop’s stewardship and how you can support that calling.
days.challenge: Identify one practical way to assist priesthood leadership.

days.title: Unity in Councils
days.message: Study how councils seek unity and revelation together.
days.challenge: Practice unity by listening first in your next discussion.

days.title: Sunday Reflection
days.message: How does the structure of the church help you serve more effectively?
days.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

days.title: The Cry from Liberty Jail
days.message: Study the plea for help and the faith shown in adversity.
days.challenge: Write one lesson from adversity that strengthens your priesthood.

days.title: Endurance and Small Moments
days.message: Reflect on enduring well and staying faithful in small moments.
days.challenge: Record one small act of faith you will do today.

days.title: Many are Called, Few are Chosen
days.message: Study why humility and purity are required for priesthood power.
days.challenge: Identify one attitude to surrender to the Lord today.

days.title: Unrighteous Dominion
days.message: Reflect on leadership through persuasion rather than control.
days.challenge: Correct one moment where you felt impatient or controlling.

days.title: Persuasion and Gentleness
days.message: Study the qualities of Christlike leadership and kindness.
days.challenge: Offer one sincere encouragement today.

days.title: Charity and Virtue
days.message: Reflect on how purity and charity increase spiritual confidence.
days.challenge: Choose a scripture or hymn that centers your mind today.

days.title: Sunday Reflection
days.message: Identify a moment this week where you felt your authority was based on love unfeigned.
days.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

days.title: Receiving the Priesthood
days.message: Study what it means to receive the priesthood and its promises.
days.challenge: Write one promise from this passage that motivates you.

days.title: Magnifying the Calling
days.message: Reflect on what it means to magnify your priesthood calling.
days.challenge: Identify one duty you can magnify this week.

days.title: Receiving the Lord’s Servants
days.message: Study the promise attached to honoring the Lord’s servants.
days.challenge: Thank a leader who has helped you recently.

days.title: The Father’s Promise
days.message: Ponder the promise of the Father to those who receive His servants.
days.challenge: Write one promise from this passage to remember.

days.title: Becoming the Sons of Moses and Aaron
days.message: Reflect on becoming God’s covenant people through priesthood service.
days.challenge: List one habit that will help you serve with greater holiness.

days.title: Bound by an Oath
days.message: Study the covenant relationship established through priesthood.
days.challenge: Record how you will honor your promises this week.

days.title: Monthly Mastery Reflection
days.message: You have completed Month 1. Record your biggest shift in understanding priesthood authority.
days.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

gatekeeper.title: The Sanctuary of the Sacrament
gatekeeper.message: Deep study of the sacrament prayers and the covenant to always remember Him.
gatekeeper.challenge: Write one phrase from the prayer that you want to live today.

gatekeeper.title: The Sanctuary of the Sacrament
gatekeeper.message: Study the promises attached to remembering the Savior.
gatekeeper.challenge: Identify one way to be more reverent during the sacrament.

gatekeeper.title: The Sanctuary of the Sacrament
gatekeeper.message: Reflect on how the sacrament renews your covenant each week.
gatekeeper.challenge: Record how 'always remember Him' applies to your week.

gatekeeper.title: The Physics of Service
gatekeeper.message: Preparing the table with cleanliness and order honors the Savior.
gatekeeper.challenge: Create a checklist to prepare the table with excellence.

gatekeeper.title: Passing with Purpose
gatekeeper.message: Pass the sacrament with focus, eye contact, and quiet dignity.
gatekeeper.challenge: Practice a steady pace and reverent posture today.

gatekeeper.title: The Bishop’s Representative
gatekeeper.message: Serve as the bishop’s hands through reliable, humble service.
gatekeeper.challenge: Ask how you can assist in a temporal need this week.

gatekeeper.title: Sunday Reflection
gatekeeper.message: How did your physical actions at the sacrament table affect your spiritual focus today?
gatekeeper.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

gatekeeper.title: The Law of the Fast
gatekeeper.message: Study the fast and how it breaks the bands of wickedness.
gatekeeper.challenge: Choose one way to make your next fast more meaningful.

gatekeeper.title: The Law of the Fast
gatekeeper.message: Reflect on fasting as a way to care for the poor.
gatekeeper.challenge: Plan a fast offering or service act this week.

gatekeeper.title: The Law of the Fast
gatekeeper.message: Consider how fasting draws you closer to the Savior.
gatekeeper.challenge: Write a prayer to accompany your next fast.

gatekeeper.title: Fast Offerings
gatekeeper.message: Learn how the Aaronic Priesthood assists in caring for the poor.
gatekeeper.challenge: Identify one family or person you can quietly serve.

gatekeeper.title: Visiting the Widow
gatekeeper.message: Look for those who need a standing minister in your ward.
gatekeeper.challenge: Reach out to someone who may feel overlooked.

gatekeeper.title: The Temporal Bishop
gatekeeper.message: See how your service supports the bishop’s temporal stewardship.
gatekeeper.challenge: Ask a leader how you can help with ward temporal needs.

gatekeeper.title: Sunday Reflection
gatekeeper.message: Who did you notice this week that was in need? How can you help them next week?
gatekeeper.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

gatekeeper.title: The Key of Repentance
gatekeeper.message: Study why the Aaronic Priesthood holds the key of repentance.
gatekeeper.challenge: Reflect on how the sacrament helps you repent.

gatekeeper.title: The Key of Repentance
gatekeeper.message: Consider how repentance prepares hearts for baptism.
gatekeeper.challenge: Write a short testimony of the power of repentance.

gatekeeper.title: The Key of Repentance
gatekeeper.message: Ponder the key of repentance as a sacred trust.
gatekeeper.challenge: Choose one way to be a better example of purity.

gatekeeper.title: The Baptismal Covenant
gatekeeper.message: Help others prepare for the remission of sins through covenant.
gatekeeper.challenge: Write down what it means to stand as a witness of God.

gatekeeper.title: Leading by Example
gatekeeper.message: Personal purity strengthens the quorum and the priesthood.
gatekeeper.challenge: Identify one habit that will strengthen your example.

gatekeeper.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ
gatekeeper.message: Invite a friend to a quorum activity or a spiritual moment.
gatekeeper.challenge: Think of one person to invite this week.

gatekeeper.title: Sunday Reflection
gatekeeper.message: How does holding the priesthood change the way you think about your own mistakes?
gatekeeper.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

gatekeeper.title: The Ministering of Angels
gatekeeper.message: Study the key of the ministering of angels and its daily meaning.
gatekeeper.challenge: Record one moment you felt guided or protected.

gatekeeper.title: The Ministering of Angels
gatekeeper.message: Reflect on how angels can serve through you.
gatekeeper.challenge: Serve someone quietly as if you were an angel.

gatekeeper.title: The Ministering of Angels
gatekeeper.message: Ponder the promise of heavenly help through the priesthood.
gatekeeper.challenge: Write a prayer asking for ministering angels.

gatekeeper.title: Recognizing Promptings
gatekeeper.message: Learn to recognize small promptings to help others.
gatekeeper.challenge: Act on one prompting within 24 hours.

gatekeeper.title: Being an Instrument
gatekeeper.message: Learn from stories of Aaronic Priesthood holders who served as angels.
gatekeeper.challenge: Read a story of service and record what inspired you.

gatekeeper.title: Preparation for the Greater Priesthood
gatekeeper.message: Look forward to the Melchizedek Priesthood with faith.
gatekeeper.challenge: Write one way you will prepare for greater responsibility.

gatekeeper.title: Month 2 Mastery Reflection
gatekeeper.message: How has your understanding of "Gatekeeping" the kingdom changed this month?
gatekeeper.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

healer.title: Healing in the New Testament
healer.message: Study the Savior’s healings and the role of faith in miracles.
healer.challenge: Record one healing story that increases your faith.

healer.title: Healing in the New Testament
healer.message: Ponder the Savior’s compassion and timing in healing.
healer.challenge: Write one way you can show compassionate faith today.

healer.title: Healing in the New Testament
healer.message: Reflect on forgiveness and healing working together.
healer.challenge: Record a prayer for someone who needs peace.

healer.title: The Will of God
healer.message: Balance desire to heal with the Lord’s timing.
healer.challenge: Write how you will seek God’s will in a blessing.

healer.title: Preparation of the Mind
healer.message: Live so the Spirit can speak through you in a blessing.
healer.challenge: Identify one habit to purify your thoughts today.

healer.title: The Gift of Discerning Spirits
healer.message: Practice sensing the needs of those you bless.
healer.challenge: Pray for discernment before you speak today.

healer.title: Sunday Reflection
healer.message: When have you seen a blessing result in peace rather than a miracle?
healer.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

healer.title: Technical Mastery
healer.message: Study the order of anointing and sealing.
healer.challenge: List the steps for anointing and sealing.

healer.title: Technical Mastery
healer.message: Review the difference between anointing and sealing.
healer.challenge: Explain the difference in your own words.

healer.title: Technical Mastery
healer.message: Focus on reverence and exactness in the ordinance.
healer.challenge: Practice the wording you would use for anointing.

healer.title: Consecrating Oil
healer.message: Study the symbolism and procedure of consecrating oil.
healer.challenge: Write a sample prayer for consecrating oil.

healer.title: The Laying on of Hands
healer.message: Learn the physical channel for priesthood power.
healer.challenge: Practice reverent hand placement and posture.

healer.title: Proper Language
healer.message: Avoid clichés and listen for the Lord’s specific words.
healer.challenge: Write a short blessing using precise, Spirit-led language.

healer.title: Sunday Reflection
healer.message: How does following the proper order of an ordinance invite more of the Spirit?
healer.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

healer.title: The Good Shepherd
healer.message: Study the Shepherd who knows His sheep by name.
healer.challenge: Write the name of one person you will minister to this week.

healer.title: The Good Shepherd
healer.message: Focus on how the Savior seeks the one who is lost.
healer.challenge: Identify one person who might be slipping through the cracks.

healer.title: The Good Shepherd
healer.message: Study the Shepherd’s patience and protection.
healer.challenge: Pray to receive a shepherd’s heart today.

healer.title: Ministering to the One
healer.message: Seek the one who needs comfort or help.
healer.challenge: Reach out to someone you have not seen in a while.

healer.title: Comforting the Needy
healer.message: Blessings for mental and emotional health require sensitivity.
healer.challenge: Write a compassionate message for someone struggling.

healer.title: The Burden of the Keys
healer.message: Learn how the Elders Quorum President shares the Bishop’s load.
healer.challenge: Identify one way to support your quorum leadership.

healer.title: Sunday Reflection
healer.message: Which sheep in your care did the Lord bring to your mind this week?
healer.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

healer.title: The Power of Godliness
healer.message: Study the power of godliness and its connection to the priesthood.
healer.challenge: Record how your service has become more sacred.

healer.title: The Power of Godliness
healer.message: Reflect on the Savior’s power revealed through ordinances.
healer.challenge: Write one moment you felt God’s power this month.

healer.title: The Power of Godliness
healer.message: Consider how priesthood ordinances reveal God’s presence.
healer.challenge: Pray for greater reverence in your service.

healer.title: Temple Readiness
healer.message: See how Melchizedek service prepares you for the endowment.
healer.challenge: Identify one step to strengthen your temple readiness.

healer.title: Strengthening the Home
healer.message: Use priesthood blessings to strengthen your family.
healer.challenge: Pray for your family by name today.

healer.title: Looking Forward
healer.message: Consider the role of patriarchs and future service.
healer.challenge: Write one goal for your next priesthood step.

healer.title: Month 2 Mastery Reflection
healer.message: Describe a moment this month where you felt you were on the Lord’s errand.
healer.challenge: Write your reflection in the journal.

aaronic.title: Standing as a Witness
aaronic.message: A Watchman must be clean to see clearly. Your personal purity is your spiritual radar.
aaronic.challenge: Identify one digital distraction you can remove from your phone today to clear your 'vision'.

aaronic.title: The Watchman's Duty
aaronic.message: The Lord has set you as a watchman unto the house of Israel. You have a responsibility to warn and protect.
aaronic.challenge: Read Ezekiel 33:1-9. How does this apply to a Priesthood holder in 2026?

aaronic.title: The Armor of God
aaronic.message: You cannot protect the quorum if you aren't wearing your own armor.
aaronic.challenge: Which piece of the armor (Truth, Righteousness, Peace, Faith, Salvation, Spirit) do you need most today?

aaronic.title: Mapping Weak Spots
aaronic.message: Moroni prepared his people by strengthening their weakest points. Where are your spiritual weak spots?
aaronic.challenge: Journal about one area where you feel tempted and how you will 'fortify' it today.

aaronic.title: The Power of the Word
aaronic.message: The word of God has a more powerful effect than the sword. It is your primary tool as a Watchman.
aaronic.challenge: Memorize one scripture verse that gives you strength when you feel pressured to compromise.

aaronic.title: Courage to Stand
aaronic.message: Let thy bowels also be full of charity... and let virtue garnish thy thoughts unceasingly.
aaronic.challenge: Defend a standard today—either by what you say or by what you choose not to participate in.

aaronic.title: Sunday Reflection: The Radar
aaronic.message: Sunday is the day to calibrate your spiritual senses.
aaronic.challenge: Reflect: When did you feel the Spirit warn you or guide you away from a distraction this week?

aaronic.title: Strengthen Thy Brethren
aaronic.message: Once you are converted, your next mission is to strengthen those around you.
aaronic.challenge: Reach out to one person in your quorum just to see how their week is going.

aaronic.title: The Empty Chair
aaronic.message: A shepherd leaves the ninety and nine to find the one. A Watchman notices who isn't there.
aaronic.challenge: Identify who was missing from church last week. Pray for them by name today.

aaronic.title: Unity in the Quorum
aaronic.message: If ye are not one, ye are not mine. Unity is the Watchman's greatest strength.
aaronic.challenge: Do a small, anonymous act of service for someone in your priesthood quorum.

aaronic.title: The Power of Invitation
aaronic.message: Your duty is to 'invite all to come unto Christ.' This starts with your friends.
aaronic.challenge: Invite a peer to a quorum activity or to sit with you during a church meeting.

aaronic.title: Unity in Diversity
aaronic.message: Every member of the quorum has a different gift. A Watchman values them all.
aaronic.challenge: Tell a quorum member something you admire about a talent or trait they have.

aaronic.title: Quorum Brotherhood
aaronic.message: The president of the deacons is to preside over twelve deacons... and sit in council with them.
aaronic.challenge: Ask your quorum leader how you can help support the quorum's goals this month.

aaronic.title: Sunday Reflection: The Body
aaronic.message: The body hath need of every member.
aaronic.challenge: Reflect: Who in your quorum seems to be struggling? How can you be a better Watchman for them?

aaronic.title: The Ministering of Angels
aaronic.message: The Aaronic Priesthood holds the keys of the ministering of angels. You can be that angel.
aaronic.challenge: Look for someone today who looks lonely or sad and offer a kind word.

aaronic.title: Missionary Coordination
aaronic.message: The Lord will send his angels to be round about you. You are part of that heavenly force.
aaronic.challenge: Ask the ward missionaries for the name of someone they are teaching. Pray for that person.

aaronic.title: The Neighborhood Watch
aaronic.message: A Watchman doesn't just look at the church; he looks at his neighbors.
aaronic.challenge: Observe your neighbors today. Is there an elderly person who needs help with yard work or trash?

aaronic.title: Simple Service
aaronic.message: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these... ye have done it unto me.
aaronic.challenge: Perform one task for a neighbor or family member today without being asked.

aaronic.title: An Instrument in His Hands
aaronic.message: We have been made instruments in the hands of God to bring about this great work.
aaronic.challenge: Write down a moment from this week where you felt the Lord used you to help someone.

aaronic.title: Vigilance in Outreach
aaronic.message: And if any man among you be strong in the Spirit, let him take with him him that is weak.
aaronic.challenge: Text a less-active quorum member a link to a spiritual video or song that you liked.

aaronic.title: Sunday Reflection: Neighborhood
aaronic.message: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
aaronic.challenge: Reflect: How does looking for ways to serve change the way you see your neighbors?

aaronic.title: The Oath and Covenant
aaronic.message: As you finish Month 3, you are preparing for the greater promises of the Melchizedek Priesthood.
aaronic.challenge: Read D&C 84:33. What does it mean to you to 'magnify' a calling?

aaronic.title: Shadowing a Mentor
aaronic.message: Wherefore, now let every man learn his duty.
aaronic.challenge: Ask an Elder or High Priest about their most sacred experience serving in the priesthood.

aaronic.title: The Eternal Perspective
aaronic.message: All things are theirs, whether life or death, or things present, or things to come.
aaronic.challenge: Why is the Aaronic Priesthood called 'Preparatory'? What are you preparing for?

aaronic.title: Readiness Check
aaronic.message: Have ye walked, keeping yourselves blameless before God?
aaronic.challenge: If you were to receive the Melchizedek Priesthood tomorrow, would you feel ready? Why or why not?

aaronic.title: The Watchman's Completion
aaronic.message: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith.
aaronic.challenge: Write a letter to your future self about the standards you have set this month.

aaronic.title: The Bridge to Mastery
aaronic.message: The Holy Ghost shall be thy constant companion, and thy scepter an unchanging scepter.
aaronic.challenge: Spend 5 minutes in total silence listening for any final promptings for this month.

aaronic.title: Month 3 Mastery Reflection
aaronic.message: He that is slothful shall not be counted worthy to stand.
aaronic.challenge: Monthly Mastery: How has your 'vision' as a Watchman improved over the last 30 days?

melchizedek.title: The Shepherd's Primary Duty
melchizedek.message: Your mission is to watch over the church always, and be with and strengthen them.
melchizedek.challenge: Write down the names of the families you minister to. Pray for each by name today.

melchizedek.title: Beyond the Visit
melchizedek.message: For thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I, even I, will both search my sheep, and seek them out.
melchizedek.challenge: Instead of a visit, find a way to 'seek out' a family's need today (check social media or ask a friend).

melchizedek.title: The Power of Listening
melchizedek.message: Let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak. A Shepherd listens more than he talks.
melchizedek.challenge: In your next conversation, practice 'active listening.' Don't think about your response while they speak.

melchizedek.title: Identifying Hidden Needs
melchizedek.message: And they shall look to the poor and the needy, and administer to their relief.
melchizedek.challenge: What is one 'unspoken' need in a home you serve? (e.g., loneliness, stress, exhaustion).

melchizedek.title: The Shepherd’s Voice
melchizedek.message: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
melchizedek.challenge: How can you help your families recognize the Lord's voice in their own lives?

melchizedek.title: Checking the Pulse
melchizedek.message: If ye have felt to sing the song of redeeming love, I would ask, can ye feel so now?
melchizedek.challenge: Reach out to a family member or ministering brother and ask how their 'heart' is doing.

melchizedek.title: Sunday Reflection: The Shepherd
melchizedek.message: The good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect: What did you learn about a family this week that you didn't know before?

melchizedek.title: Seeking Spiritual Gifts
melchizedek.message: Seek ye earnestly the best gifts, always remembering for what they are given.
melchizedek.challenge: Ask the Lord for a specific gift (like discernment) to help a family you serve.

melchizedek.title: Praying for the One
melchizedek.message: I began to feel a desire for the welfare of my brethren... I did pour out my whole soul unto God.
melchizedek.challenge: Dedicate 10 minutes today to a prayer focused solely on the welfare of one struggling family.

melchizedek.title: Acting on Promptings
melchizedek.message: I will tell you in your mind and in your heart, by the Holy Ghost.
melchizedek.challenge: Follow the first 'random' spiritual thought you have today to call or text someone.

melchizedek.title: Instrument for Prayer
melchizedek.message: Succor the weak, lift up the hands which hang down, and strengthen the feeble knees.
melchizedek.challenge: Ask the Lord: 'Who can I be an answer to a prayer for today?' Follow the answer.

melchizedek.title: The Ministering Interview
melchizedek.message: A stewardship is an account of one's service. Your leaders need your 'eyes' on the flock.
melchizedek.challenge: Contact your quorum leader and give a 2-minute update on your families with the Spirit.

melchizedek.title: Revelation in Stewardship
melchizedek.message: If thou shalt ask, thou shalt receive revelation upon revelation.
melchizedek.challenge: Ask for a specific prompting regarding the temporal needs of a family (food, job, health).

melchizedek.title: Sunday Reflection: Answer to Prayer
melchizedek.message: Be thou humble; and the Lord thy God shall lead thee by the hand.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect: How did the Lord use you as an instrument for someone else's prayer this week?

melchizedek.title: Creating Holy Places
melchizedek.message: Stand ye in holy places, and be not moved. Help your families make their homes sacred.
melchizedek.challenge: Suggest a spiritual resource (like a specific talk) to a family you minister to.

melchizedek.title: Priesthood in the Home
melchizedek.message: No power or influence can or ought to be maintained by virtue of the priesthood, only by persuasion.
melchizedek.challenge: Evaluate your own leadership at home. Are you leading with 'love unfeigned'?

melchizedek.title: The Neighborhood Shepherd
melchizedek.message: A certain Samaritan... had compassion on him, and went to him, and bound up his wounds.
melchizedek.challenge: Is there someone on your street without priesthood holders in the home? Offer your help today.

melchizedek.title: The Charity of a Shepherd
melchizedek.message: Charity is the pure love of Christ, and it endureth forever.
melchizedek.challenge: Think of the 'difficult-to-love' person in your quorum. Pray specifically for them today.

melchizedek.title: Power of Godliness
melchizedek.message: Therefore, in the ordinances thereof, the power of godliness is manifest.
melchizedek.challenge: Prepare yourself spiritually to perform or participate in an ordinance this coming month.

melchizedek.title: A Shepherd’s Compassion
melchizedek.message: Have ye any that are sick among you? ... Bring them hither and I will heal them.
melchizedek.challenge: Reach out to someone who is physically ill and offer a listening ear or a small service.

melchizedek.title: Sunday Reflection: The Power
melchizedek.message: The rights of the priesthood are inseparably connected with the powers of heaven.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect: Where did you see 'The Power of Godliness' manifest in a home you visited?

melchizedek.title: The Patriarchal Order
melchizedek.message: I sought for the blessings of the fathers... to be a greater follower of righteousness.
melchizedek.challenge: Research one ancestor who held the priesthood. What was their legacy?

melchizedek.title: Leading with Gentleness
melchizedek.message: By kindness, and pure knowledge, which shall greatly enlarge the soul.
melchizedek.challenge: Correct a situation today (at home or work) using only 'gentleness' and 'meekness'.

melchizedek.title: Ancestral Links
melchizedek.message: The earth will be smitten with a curse unless there is a welding link... between the fathers and children.
melchizedek.challenge: Log into FamilySearch and find one name to take to the temple for an ordinance.

melchizedek.title: Legacy of Faith
melchizedek.message: I, Enos, knowing my father that he was a just man—for he taught me in his nurture.
melchizedek.challenge: What 'priesthood heritage' are you leaving behind for the next generation?

melchizedek.title: The Higher Priesthood
melchizedek.message: The power and authority of the higher, or Melchizedek Priesthood, is to hold the keys of all the spiritual blessings.
melchizedek.challenge: Journal about how your life has changed since you began focusing on these spiritual blessings.

melchizedek.title: The Shepherd’s Completion
melchizedek.message: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect on the names of every person you have served this month. Give thanks for them.

melchizedek.title: Month 3 Mastery Reflection
melchizedek.message: He that is slothful shall not be counted worthy to stand.
melchizedek.challenge: Monthly Mastery: In what way has your 'Shepherd's Voice' become clearer this month?

aaronic.title: The Preparatory Crown
aaronic.message: The sons of Moses and Aaron shall offer an acceptable offering and sacrifice.
aaronic.challenge: List three things you have sacrificed this month to stay worthy of your office.

aaronic.title: The Oath and Covenant
aaronic.message: Those who are faithful unto the obtaining of these two priesthoods... become the sons of Moses and Aaron.
aaronic.challenge: Read the 'Oath and Covenant' in D&C 84. What is the one thing God promises you?

aaronic.title: The Melchizedek Goal
aaronic.message: Your current service is the training ground for the higher priesthood.
aaronic.challenge: Ask an Elder: 'What was the most significant change you felt when you were ordained?'

aaronic.title: Temple Readiness
aaronic.message: Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? He that hath clean hands and a pure heart.
aaronic.challenge: Schedule a brief chat with your Bishop about your current temple worthiness.

aaronic.title: The Garment of Holiness
aaronic.message: Priesthood service is about putting on 'holy garments for glory and for beauty.'
aaronic.challenge: How does the way you dress for church affect your internal feeling of priesthood power?

aaronic.title: A Future Father
aaronic.message: The priesthood is the link between generations. You are a future link.
aaronic.challenge: Think of your future family. What kind of Priesthood holder do they need you to be today?

aaronic.title: Sunday Reflection: The Horizon
aaronic.message: Sunday is for looking toward the harvest.
aaronic.challenge: Reflect: How has your vision of your future changed since Day 1 of this app?

aaronic.title: The Power of the Endowment
aaronic.message: The Lord's people must be 'endowed with power from on high.'
aaronic.challenge: Look up 'Endowment' in the Bible Dictionary. What does it actually mean to be endowed?

aaronic.title: The Key of Knowledge
aaronic.message: The greater priesthood holdeth the key of the knowledge of God.
aaronic.challenge: What is one question about God that you want to find the answer to this week?

aaronic.title: The Presence of God
aaronic.message: The Melchizedek priesthood has the privilege of receiving the mysteries of the kingdom.
aaronic.challenge: Spend 10 minutes in deep, quiet prayer asking for a 'mystery' (a personal truth) to be revealed.

aaronic.title: The Higher Calling
aaronic.message: The priesthood is 'without beginning of days or end of years.'
aaronic.challenge: Visualize your life 50 years from now. How does the Priesthood define that version of you?

aaronic.title: The Holy Order
aaronic.message: Priests were ordained after the order of his Son, in a manner that the people might know.
aaronic.challenge: How can your actions today help people 'know' more about Jesus Christ?

aaronic.title: Worthy of the Crown
aaronic.message: There is laid up for me a crown of righteousness.
aaronic.challenge: What is the biggest obstacle remaining between you and your 'crown' of mastery?

aaronic.title: Sunday Reflection: The Order
aaronic.message: The power and authority of the lesser priesthood is to hold the keys of the ministering of angels.
aaronic.challenge: Reflect: When did you feel most like an 'authorized agent' of the Lord this week?

aaronic.title: The Final Ascent
aaronic.message: You are entering the final two weeks. Finish with the strength of a Priest.
aaronic.challenge: Identify one 'bad habit' you will finally leave behind during these last 14 days.

aaronic.title: The Sealing Power
aaronic.message: Whatsoever ye shall seal on earth shall be sealed in heaven.
aaronic.challenge: Why is the sealing power the 'ultimate' power of the Priesthood?

aaronic.title: The Spirit of Elijah
aaronic.message: The keys of this dispensation are committed into your hands.
aaronic.challenge: Do one act of family history research today to 'turn your heart' to your fathers.

aaronic.title: The Gathering of Israel
aaronic.message: Moses appeared and committed the keys of the gathering of Israel.
aaronic.challenge: Who can you 'gather' back to the fold today? Send an encouraging text.

aaronic.title: The Covenant Path
aaronic.message: Ye must press forward with a steadfastness in Christ.
aaronic.challenge: Write down your 'Priesthood Creed'—a list of 5 things you will always do as a holder.

aaronic.title: A King and Priest
aaronic.message: He hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father.
aaronic.challenge: What does it mean to act with 'royalty' in your daily interactions?

aaronic.title: Sunday Reflection: The Finish
aaronic.message: If any man among you be strong in the Spirit, let him take with him him that is weak.
aaronic.challenge: Reflect: Who have you helped 'gather' toward the temple this month?

aaronic.title: The Unchanging Scepter
aaronic.message: Thy scepter an unchanging scepter of righteousness and truth.
aaronic.challenge: How can you ensure your priesthood influence is 'unchanging' even when life gets hard?

aaronic.title: The Presence of the Comforter
aaronic.message: The Comforter... shall teach you all things.
aaronic.challenge: What is the most important lesson the Holy Ghost has taught you in the last 120 days?

aaronic.title: The Great High Priest
aaronic.message: We have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God.
aaronic.challenge: How has your relationship with Jesus Christ changed through this training?

aaronic.title: The End from the Beginning
aaronic.message: My name is Jehovah, and I know the end from the beginning.
aaronic.challenge: Trust the Lord with your future. Write a prayer of total surrender to His will.

aaronic.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
aaronic.message: The keys of the kingdom of God are committed unto man on the earth.
aaronic.challenge: You are a key-holder in training. How will you use your keys today?

aaronic.title: The Crown of Life
aaronic.message: He shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
aaronic.challenge: Celebrate your progress. Look back at your Day 1 Journal entry.

aaronic.title: The Final Stewardship
aaronic.message: It is required of every steward to render an account of his stewardship.
aaronic.challenge: Prepare your final 'Mastery Report.' What are you most proud of?

aaronic.title: 120 Days: Mastery Complete
aaronic.message: He that is found worthy shall stand, but he that is slothful shall not be counted worthy.
aaronic.challenge: Final Mastery Reflection: You have finished the path. What is your new Priesthood Identity?

melchizedek.title: The Patriarchal Vision
melchizedek.message: It is the duty of the Twelve... to ordain evangelical ministers.
melchizedek.challenge: Research what a 'Patriarchal' role means in the context of the family.

melchizedek.title: The Sealing Power
melchizedek.message: The welding link between the fathers and the children.
melchizedek.challenge: Identify a 'broken link' in your family tree (spiritual or genealogical) and pray for its healing.

melchizedek.title: The Law of Consecration
melchizedek.message: Thou wilt remember the poor, and consecrate of thy properties for their support.
melchizedek.challenge: How can you 'consecrate' your time more effectively to the Lord's work this week?

melchizedek.title: Holiness to the Lord
melchizedek.message: Thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave upon it... HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
melchizedek.challenge: How would your day change if those words were written on your own heart?

melchizedek.title: The Power of the Endowment
melchizedek.message: Thy servants may go forth from this house armed with thy power.
melchizedek.challenge: If you have been endowed, plan a temple trip. If not, study the dedicatory prayer of the Kirtland Temple.

melchizedek.title: The High Priest’s Intercession
melchizedek.message: He ever liveth to make intercession for them.
melchizedek.challenge: Intercede for someone today. Pray for them with the same fervor you would for yourself.

melchizedek.title: Sunday Reflection: The Legacy
melchizedek.message: The order of this priesthood was confirmed to be handed down from father to son.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect: What priesthood legacy are you building for those who will follow you?

melchizedek.title: The Keys of Elijah
melchizedek.message: The hearts of the fathers shall turn to the children, and the children to the fathers.
melchizedek.challenge: Perform an ordinance for an ancestor this week, or find a name to be done.

melchizedek.title: The Presence of God
melchizedek.message: The privilege of receiving the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven.
melchizedek.challenge: What 'mystery' or deep doctrine has the Lord made clear to you during this 4-month path?

melchizedek.title: The Anchor of the Soul
melchizedek.message: Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and steadfast.
melchizedek.challenge: How has the Priesthood acted as an 'anchor' for you during a recent trial?

melchizedek.title: Magnifying the Office
melchizedek.message: Whoso is faithful unto the obtaining these two priesthoods... and magnifying their calling.
melchizedek.challenge: Does 'magnifying' mean making it bigger, or making it clearer? Journal your thoughts.

melchizedek.title: The Order of Melchizedek
melchizedek.message: Melchizedek... was a king over the land of Salem... and his people had waxed strong in iniquity.
melchizedek.challenge: Like Melchizedek, how can you establish 'peace' in your own home or circle of influence?

melchizedek.title: The Pure Love of Christ
melchizedek.message: Charity is the pure love of Christ. Without it, the priesthood is sounding brass.
melchizedek.challenge: Perform an act of service today that requires genuine, difficult charity.

melchizedek.title: Sunday Reflection: The Anchor
melchizedek.message: Thy dominion shall be an everlasting dominion.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect: Where have you seen your 'dominion' (influence) grow through love unfeigned this week?

melchizedek.title: The Final Ascent
melchizedek.message: Give diligence to make your calling and election sure.
melchizedek.challenge: Identify one area of your life that still belongs to the 'world' and give it to the Lord.

melchizedek.title: The Welding Link
melchizedek.message: A welding link of some kind or other between the fathers and the children.
melchizedek.challenge: Help a younger priesthood holder understand their 'link' in the chain today.

melchizedek.title: The Spirit of Prophecy
melchizedek.message: The testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.
melchizedek.challenge: In your next blessing or ministering visit, listen specifically for a 'prophetic' word of hope.

melchizedek.title: The Gathering of Israel
melchizedek.message: Moses appeared... and committed the keys of the gathering.
melchizedek.challenge: Invite someone who has stepped away from the church to a casual lunch or activity.

melchizedek.title: The Covenant Path
melchizedek.message: Ye shall come forth in the first resurrection... and shall inherit thrones, kingdoms, principalities.
melchizedek.challenge: Study the promises of the New and Everlasting Covenant. Which one humbles you the most?

melchizedek.title: A King and Priest
melchizedek.message: Ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and an holy nation.
melchizedek.challenge: How can you elevate the 'culture' of your quorum to be more 'holy'?

melchizedek.title: Sunday Reflection: The Promise
melchizedek.message: And he that receiveth my Father receiveth my Father’s kingdom.
melchizedek.challenge: Reflect: How has your understanding of 'The Father's Kingdom' expanded this month?

melchizedek.title: The Unchanging Scepter
melchizedek.message: Without compulsory means it shall flow unto thee forever and ever.
melchizedek.challenge: Practice 'leading without force' in a difficult conversation today.

melchizedek.title: The Presence of the Comforter
melchizedek.message: He shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever.
melchizedek.challenge: Record a time this month when the Comforter gave you 'peace' that surpassed understanding.

melchizedek.title: The Great High Priest
melchizedek.message: We have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities.
melchizedek.challenge: How can you be more 'touched' by the infirmities of those you minister to?

melchizedek.title: The End from the Beginning
melchizedek.message: The voice of the Lord is unto all men.
melchizedek.challenge: If you could speak to yourself on Day 1, what would you say?

melchizedek.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
melchizedek.message: The keys of the kingdom of God are committed unto man on the earth.
melchizedek.challenge: As a Melchizedek Priesthood holder, what 'gates' have you opened for others this month?

melchizedek.title: The Crown of Life
melchizedek.message: The crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
melchizedek.challenge: Celebrate the men you serve with. Send a message of gratitude to your Quorum President.

melchizedek.title: The Final Stewardship
melchizedek.message: It is required of every steward to render an account.
melchizedek.challenge: Prepare your final 'Mastery Report.' What is the one soul you are most grateful to have served?

melchizedek.title: 120 Days: Mastery Complete
melchizedek.message: He that is found worthy shall stand.
melchizedek.challenge: Final Mastery Reflection: You have finished the path. What is your new Priesthood Identity?
